summary: This is a US Marshals Service prisoner schedule report for the Brooklyn Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) dated July 18, 2019. It details the scheduled court appearances, transfers, and meetings for multiple inmates, including one with a specific warning about violent tendencies related to illicit activities. The document lists judges and deputy US marshals assigned to various proceedings.

persons.name: Engelmayer, P
persons.context: Presiding over a sentencing hearing for an inmate with a weapon offense.

persons.name: Pauley, W
persons.context: Presiding over a status hearing for an inmate with dangerous drug charges and noted violent tendencies.

persons.name: Castel, K
persons.context: Presiding over a sentencing hearing for an inmate with a weapon offense.

persons.name: Abrams, R
persons.context: Presiding over an 'Other' hearing regarding the appointment of counsel for an inmate charged with fraud.

persons.name: Swain, L
persons.context: Presiding over a status hearing for an inmate with dangerous drug charges and a long-term takeout order.

persons.name: Broderick, V
persons.context: Presiding over a sentencing hearing for an inmate with a weapon offense who practices boxing.

persons.name: Furman, J
persons.context: Presiding over a sentencing hearing for an inmate with dangerous drug charges.

events.title: Prisoner Schedule at Brooklyn MDC
events.description: Multiple inmates are scheduled for transfers within the facility, court hearings (sentencing, status), and meetings. One inmate has a specific warning about violent tendencies related to compromising illicit activities.

locations: St. Andrews (location for a proffer meeting)
keyFacts: The document is a prisoner schedule for the Brooklyn MDC on July 18, 2019, detailing inmate movements and court appearances.
One inmate entry includes a 'Special Caution' warning: 'SUBJECT HAS MADE STATEMENTS INDICATING WILLINGNESS TO COMMIT VIOLENCE ON PERSONS WHO COMPROMISE HIS ALLEGED ILLICIT ACTIVITIES.'
Another inmate is noted to 'PRACTICES BOXING' under miscellaneous cautions.
Multiple federal judges (Engelmayer, Pauley, Castel, Abrams, Swain, Broderick, Furman) are listed as presiding over various hearings.
The offenses listed for inmates include weapon offenses (code 5299), dangerous drugs (code 3599), and fraud (code 2699).
